transparency_law.name: District of Columbia Freedom of Information Act

response_requirements.initial_response_description: 15 business days (excluding Saturdays, Sundays, and legal holidays) to make records accessible or notify requester of determination not to provide records. For body-worn camera recordings, 25 business days.
extension_conditions: Searching for and collecting requested records from separate facilities
Searching for, collecting, and examining voluminous records
Consulting with another public body having substantial interest in determination
For body-worn camera recordings: inability to procure redaction vendor (15-day extension)
response_requirements.no_response_consequence: Failure to respond within prescribed timelines is deemed a denial of the request

fee_structure.standard_copy_fee: Actual cost of document duplication (reasonable standard charges)
fee_structure.electronic_fee: Actual cost of duplication for electronic records
fee_structure.search_time_fee: Actual cost of search and review for commercial requests; search costs for non-commercial requests
waiver_criteria: Furnishing information can be considered as primarily benefiting the general public
Fees limited to direct costs only
Review costs cannot include determining issues of law or policy
fee_structure.notes: Fees limited to actual cost of searching, reviewing, redacting, and making copies. No advance payment required unless requester previously failed to pay or estimated fee exceeds $250.

exemptions.description: Trade secrets and commercial or financial information obtained from outside the government, if disclosure would result in substantial harm to the competitive position of the person from whom the information was obtained
Information of a personal nature where public disclosure would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy
Body-worn camera recordings inside a personal residence or related to domestic violence, stalking, or sexual assault incidents

Investigatory records compiled for law-enforcement purposes that would interfere with enforcement proceedings, deprive fair trial rights, reveal confidential sources, disclose investigative techniques, or endanger law enforcement personnel
Inter-agency or intra-agency memorandums or letters that would not be available by law to a party other than a public body
Test questions and answers to be used in future license, employment, or academic examinations
Information specifically exempted from disclosure by statute with specific withholding criteria
Information classified under federal executive orders for national defense or foreign policy purposes
Response plans and vulnerability assessments related to terrorism prevention and critical infrastructure protection
Names of employees providing whistleblower information to government agencies

appeal_process.appeal_authority: Mayor of the District of Columbia (for most agencies); direct judicial review for Council and Attorney General records
appeal_process.appeal_description: Administrative appeals reviewed by Mayor within 10 business days (excluding Saturdays, Sundays, and legal holidays). If appeal denied or no response, petitioner may institute judicial proceedings.
appeal_process.court_jurisdiction: Superior Court of the District of Columbia
appeal_process.burden_of_proof: Burden is on the public agency to sustain its action

penalties.civil: Court may award reasonable attorney fees to prevailing petitioner. Court may enjoin agency from withholding records.

requester_requirements.specific_format: Written request identifying records with sufficient specificity
requester_requirements.notes: Any person may request records. No residency requirement or need to state purpose.

specific_obligations: Respond within 15 business days (25 for body-worn camera recordings)
Explain any denials with specific exemption citations
Maintain records for public inspection during business hours
Notify requester of determination to grant or deny access

oversight_body.name: Office of the Mayor - FOIA Appeals
oversight_body.role: Administrative appeals authority for most DC agencies; provides oversight of FOIA compliance
enforcement_powers: Issue determinations on appeals within 10 business days

validation_metadata.verification_notes: Data extracted from official D.C. Code sections. Response timeline verified as 15 business days (excluding Saturdays, Sundays, and legal holidays) per § 2-532, matching ground truth canonical-values.json. All exemptions verified from § 2-534. Appeal process verified from § 2-537. Fee structure and other procedural requirements extracted from official statute.
